bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Reference Librarian, Springfield Library, December 6, 1944

div1.p: Hench requests help in identifying a newspaper clipping from 1905.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Reference Librarian, Springfield Library, December 6, 1944
div1.opener:
PSH/cb
6 December, 1944
The Reference Librarian
Springfield Library
Springfield, Ohio
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
I am very anxious to identify the newspaper from which the
enclosed clipping was taken. The enclosed is a photograph which I made
of an item in the scrap book of Mrs. Walter Reed, a scrap book concern-
ing the work of her husband. Obviously, the date of the newspaper clipping
is April 11, 1905. Inspecting the old clipping, I found the names of five
or six physicians, none of whom are now living, but an examination of an
old directory of the American Medical Association showed that all of them
lived in Springfield, Ohio; therefore, undoubtedly, this clipping came from
an Ohio newspaper, dated April 11, 1905.

I would appreciate it greatly if you could identify this paper
for me and have a photostatic copy made of the entire article and page.
My interest in this matter will be shown by the enclosed reprint.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, PHILIP S. HENCH, Lt. Col., M.C.
Chief of the Medical Service Enc. - 2
